item.title: Powerbot
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“AnxietyX, post:42, topic:387543”][quote author=mr extremez link=topic=483345.msg3540437#msg3540437 date=1300826291]
Does powerbot still steal accounts?
[/quote]
yes it does…when you write the name and pass they remember it. i just lost my lvl 121 acc to powerbot.org…they are selling it…-.-[/quote]
As I’ve repeated multiple times, don’t talk about what you don’t understand. The bot itself isn’t stealing passwords, it’s the scripts that steal your passwords.

Read full topic

item.title: Powerbot
item.dc:creator: @SpeedIsMeh SpeedIsMeh
item.description:
@SpeedIsMeh wrote:

[quote=“m.dog311, post:36, topic:387543”][quote author=Impulse Arrow link=topic=483345.msg3546506#msg3546506 date=1301219961]
Let me clear this up for you guys;

PowerBot doesn’t steal accounts, it was Arbiters PRO Scripts (Thats why we were never allowed to see the code, it would always be a .jar) that had the malicious content in them, Arbiter and Jacmob were planning to leave about 6 months ago, but their plan took 6 months to put into action, they planned to steal a shitload of accounts, when they heard FT and WILD were coming out, they delayed their movement, and they hacked 10000b worth of stuff.
[/quote]
You’re dumb…[/quote]

This.

Isn’t it obvious yet that Paris (ins3) is a liar?

Read full topic

item.title: Powerbot
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

You are also not aware of all the people that were releasing password stealing scripts. There were tons that I know about that were released on the site in the weeks leading up to free trade… Arbiter’s was just the easiest to put the blame on, and Gh0$t’s hack was the most effective. Paris is an idiot, and didn’t know what to do about it. And the current developers are idiots for continuing to not remove the fucking getPassword() method that any script can access…

Read full topic

item.title: Powerbot
item.dc:creator: @trewq343 trewq343
item.description:
@trewq343 wrote:

many of us are not aware that “Powerbot” also runs a service to SELL RUNESCAPE GOLD!!! obviously the blame was put on arbiter…

Read full topic

item.title: Powerbot
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

Paris says right in the video “I’m not going to admit anything, but it’ll be pretty obvious and I wont deny it” And these people are Someone67, optix/ptix/synt[a]x, Jacmob, etc etc… And the timing of it all is pretty bad, but thats basically because the shit between Paris & Jacmob happened right before free trade, which was ultimately the reason these hacks took place. And Paris also says in the video “I don’t know how ghost was able to swap the jars out”

Read full topic

item.title: Powerbot
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“m.dog311, post:26, topic:387543”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=483345.msg3542741#msg3542741 date=1300985570]

[quote author=ytuio9 link=topic=483345.msg3542628#msg3542628 date=1300977057]

To be honest, I scan each script before I even use it. Generally though (not after the v2 update) I was writing my own. My suggestion to everybody is to not save your password within RSBot, just make sure you are logged in before starting. As well as, not to download a script with more than 800 lines of code, as at this point it becomes harder to look at, and things can easily slip past your mind. Another tip, make sure the person who made the script is not just some noob, but is a rather respected member (you can generally tell this).

Yeah, like Arbiter.

Except his scripts were clean…
[/quote]No they weren’t, don’t fall for the RSBuddy BS

BRB FINDING THE RECORDING OF PARIS SAYING THAT ARBITER DIDNT DO ANYTHING

EDIT: FOUND IT!!!
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-6Ju4nmzLEA

How do you know that’s paris?
[/quote]This. And I only hear pandaman saying that they lied anyway, and anyone else notice the change in quality between the two voices?

Mics can do that bro… And I have had many people confirm that that is Paris… (Ones that I know for a fact have talked with him before).[/quote]Who would that be? And still, where does Paris say Arbiter didn’t do anything? It seems rather fake to me…
Does it ever say where gh0st got the passwords?

The timing is enough for me. Massive hack problems -> Rsbuddy created all in a very short time frame; I don’t think so.

Read full topic

Another tip, make sure the person who made the script is not just some noob, but is a rather respected member (you can generally tell this).

EDIT: FOUND IT!!!

How do you know that’s paris?
[/quote]This. And I only hear pandaman saying that they lied anyway, and anyone else notice the change in quality between the two voices?[/quote]
Mics can do that bro… And I have had many people confirm that that is Paris… (Ones that I know for a fact have talked with him before).

item.title: Powerbot
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

Powerbot in no way dirrectly steals passwords, some scripts may be programed to do this but its pretty easy to look over them and see if they would. If you really feel un safe just don’t put your password in the client, only your user name.

Read full topic

item.title: Powerbot
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

I had used them even during the epidemic, I only stopped for the fact of, I had 50 scripts that I didn’t want to sort through and check. So I just changed my passwords and went on with it.

Read full topic

item.title: Powerbot
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:18, topic:387543”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=483345.msg3542246#msg3542246 date=1300938900]

To be honest, I scan each script before I even use it. Generally though (not after the v2 update) I was writing my own. My suggestion to everybody is to not save your password within RSBot, just make sure you are logged in before starting. As well as, not to download a script with more than 800 lines of code, as at this point it becomes harder to look at, and things can easily slip past your mind. Another tip, make sure the person who made the script is not just some noob, but is a rather respected member (you can generally tell this).

Yeah, like Arbiter.

Except his scripts were clean…
[/quote]No they weren’t, don’t fall for the RSBuddy BS

Well, each script that I used from him was clean, this includes his FM, Fishing, Cooking, and WC’ing bots. This was before I even thought about the fact that RSBot saves your passwords and scripts would be able to access that. So at the time, I didn’t look.[/quote]Yes they were clean when we first used them, but they update in a way that people cannot see the code, it was very easy for him to change the script.

Read full topic
